definition: Wang Li (1900-1986), one of the pioneers of modern Chinese linguistics
surname Wang
king or monarch/best or strongest of its type/grand/great
to rule/to reign over
surname Li
power/force/strength/ability/strenuously
Wang Lee-Hom (1976-), Taiwanese-American singer
Wang Lixiong (1953-), Chinese writer, author of Yellow Peril 黃禍|黄祸[Huang2 huo4]

sentences.english: David, meet Wang Li, your new colleague.
sentences.chinese: 大卫，来见见王力，你的新伙伴。

sentences.english: My name is Wang Li, my telephone number is 669745. Thanks.
sentences.chinese: 人的名字叫王力，电话号码是669745。

sentences.english: Do you know the man whose name is Wang Li ?
sentences.chinese: 你认识名叫王力的那个人吗？

sentences.english: Wang Li ran fast I couldn't catch up with him.
sentences.chinese: 王力跑得如此快，以致于我赶不上他。

sentences.english: Mr. Smith, th is is my good friend Wang Li.
sentences.chinese: 史密斯先生，这是我的好朋友王力。

definition: variant of 彬[bin1]
Ding Ling (1904-1986), female novelist, author of novel The Sun Shines over the Sanggan River 太陽照在桑乾河上|太阳照在桑干河上, attacked during the 1950s as anti-Party
Sun Yutang (1911-1985), historian and poet, studied in Tokyo, Oxford and Harvard
Yang Bin (1963-), Chinese-Dutch businessman
Zhang Tianyi (1906-1985), children's writer, author of prize-winning fairy tale Secret of the Magic Gourd 寶葫蘆的秘密|宝葫芦的秘密[Bao3 hu2 lu5 de5 Mi4 mi4]
surname Jiang/refers to Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石
big/large/great
Zhang Bin (1979-), CCTV sports presenter
Wang Zhen (1908-1993), Chinese political figure
Chen Yun (1905-1995), communist leader and economist
Wu Han (1909-1969), historian, author of biography of Zhu Yuanzhang 朱元璋, hounded to his death together with several members of his family during the cultural revolution
Jianhua district of Qiqihar city 齊齊哈爾|齐齐哈尔[Qi2 qi2 ha1 er3], Heilongjiang
Zheng Yili (1906-2002), translator, editor and lexicographer, creator of the Zheng coding
rapid/fast
Li Peng (1928-), leading PRC politician, prime minister 1987-1998, reportedly leader of the conservative faction advocating the June 1989 Tiananmen clampdown
Wei Wei (1920-2008), novelist and poet, author of award-winning novel The East 東方|东方 about the Korean war
